dcterms:description: The Penn Treebank dataset is a well-recognized benchmark dataset for language modeling experiments. The language model is supposed to make prediction of the next word based on the previous text. The dataset has 10k words in its vocabulary and consists of 929k training words, 73k validation words, and 82k test words. It does not contain capital letters, numbers, or punctuation which constitute 5.8% out of vocabulary (OoV) tokens.
dcterms:title: Penn Treebank (PTB) dataset

dcterms:creator: S. Merity
C. Xiong
J. Bradbury
R. Socher
dcterms:description: WikiText-2 contains sentences sourced from Wikipedia articles and is more challenging compared with the PTB dataset. The dataset contains a vocabulary of 33,278 words and includes 2M training words, 210K validation words, and 240K test words. Unlike PTB dataset, it retains capitalization, punctuation, and numbers and has 2.6% OoV tokens.
dcterms:title: WikiText-2 (WT2) dataset
